content: of cold water large enough to fully immerse the hat do not use regular laundry soap most laundry soaps have enzymes that will break down the proteins in wool and degrade it 2 submerge the hat try not to agitate it too much so that it doesn t felt 3 let the hat soak for 15-20 minutes 4 keeping the hat in the bowl dump out the soapy water refill the bowl with fresh water and gently slosh it around to rinse repeat this process if needed try not to agitate it here either ⓒ 2022 maggie billings maggiebillingsknits@gmail com 5 after dumping out the water from the last rinse gently press the hat against the side of the bowl to get out some water don t wring it out 6 lay the hat out on a dry towel roll the towel up with the hat inside and press on the roll to remove more water i step on it for this step- it gets more water out with less effort on my part 7 unroll the towel and remove the hat lay the hat out flat on a surface that won t be damaged by water and leave it to dry completely don t leave it in the sun as this can discolor the wool 8 once it s totally dry trim the tails of the yarn that are still sticking out from where you wove them in and your hat is ready to wear this pattern may be reprinted for educational purposes email maggiebillingsknits@gmail com with any questions or comments more of my patterns can be found on ravelry https //www ravelry com/designers/maggie-billings ⓒ 2022 maggie billings maggiebillingsknits@gmail com
